{"step_by_step_thinking": "The angle of the jaw is innervated by the mandibular nerve, which is the third division of the trigeminal nerve. The maxillary nerve is the second division of the trigeminal nerve and it supplies the mid-face. The lesser occipital nerve and the greater auricular nerve are both branches of the cervical plexus and they supply areas of the skin on the neck and the ear, not the jaw.", "answer_choice": "A"}
